00035 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00036 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00037 
00038 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096
00039 
00040 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00041 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00042 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00047 struct xnthread;
00048 struct task_struct;
00049 
00050 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00051 
00052     /* Kernel mode side */
00053 
00054 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00055     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00056        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00057     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00058     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00059     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00060     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00061        - NULL for RT K threads,
00062        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00063        - current for RT US threads.
00064     */
00065 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00066 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00067 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00068 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00069 
00070     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00071     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00072     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00073     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00074 
00075     /* User mode side */
00076     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00077     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00078 
00079     /* Init block */
00080     struct xnthread *self;
00081     int imask;
00082     const char *name;
00083     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00084     void *cookie;
00085 
00086 } xnarchtcb_t;
00087 
00088 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00089 
00090     unsigned exception;
00091     struct pt_regs *regs;
00092 
00093 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00094 
00095 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00098 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00099 /* FIXME: FPU faults ignored by the nanokernel on PPC. */
00100 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  (0)
00101 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00102    Linux stack context. */
00103 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->exception == ADEOS_ACCESS_TRAP)
00104 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00105                                  ((fi)->exception != ADEOS_IABR_TRAP && \
00106                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP && \
00107                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP))
00108 #ifdef __cplusplus
00109 extern "C" {
00110 #endif

00112 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00113 
00114 {
00115 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00116     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00117         return vmalloc(bytes);
00118 #endif
00119 
00120     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00121 }
00122 
00123 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00124 
00125 {
00126 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00127     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00128         vfree(chunk);
00129     else
00130 #endif
00131         kfree(chunk);
00132 }

00137     rthal_irq_host_pend(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00147                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))

00152 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00153 
00154 {
00155     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00156 
00157     adeos_load_cpuid();
00158 
00159     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00160        and always inside a critical section. */
00161     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00163     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00164 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00165     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00166     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00167     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00168                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00169                     : NULL);
00170 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00171 }
00172 
00173 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00174     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00175 }
00176 
00177 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00178                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00179 {
00180     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00181     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00182 
00183     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00184 
00185     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00186         {
00187         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00188 
00189         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00190 
00191 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00192         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00193            they don't work properly in our context. */
00194         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00195             asm volatile (
00196                 "dssall;\n"
00197 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00198                 "sync;\n"
00199 #endif
00200                 : : );
00201         }
00202 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00203 
00204         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00205         get_mmu_context(mm);
00206         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00207 
00208         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00209          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00210         current = prev;
00211         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00212 
00213         barrier();
00214         }
00215     else
00216         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00217         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00218 }
00219 
00220 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00221                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00222 {
00223     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00224 }
00225 
00226 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00227 
00228 {
00229     /* Empty */
00230 }
00231 
00232 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00233                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00234                                          const char *name)
00235 {
00236     tcb->user_task = current;
00237     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00238     tcb->ksp = 0;
00239     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00240 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00241     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00242     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00243 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00244     tcb->entry = NULL;
00245     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00246     tcb->self = thread;
00247     tcb->imask = 0;
00248     tcb->name = name;
00249 }
00250 
00251 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00252 
00253 {
00254     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00255     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00256     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00257     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00258 }
00259 
00260 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00261                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00262                                        void *cookie,
00263                                        int imask,
00264                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00265                                        char *name)
00266 {
00267     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00268 
00269     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00270 
00271     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00272     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00273     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00274     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00275     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00276     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00277 
00278     tcb->entry = entry;
00279     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00280     tcb->self = thread;
00281     tcb->imask = imask;
00282     tcb->name = name;
00283 }
00284 
00285 /* No lazy FPU init on PPC. */
00286 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) (1)
00287 
00288 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00289 
00290 {
00291 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00292     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00293         rthal_enable_fpu();
00294 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00295 }
00296 
00297 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00298 
00299 {
00300 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00301     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00302        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00303     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00304     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00305 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00306 }
00307 
00308 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00309 
00310 {
00311 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00312 
00313     if(tcb->fpup)
00314         {
00315         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00316 
00317         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00318             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00319         }   
00320 
00321 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00322 }
00323 
00324 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00325 
00326 {
00327 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00328 
00329     if(tcb->fpup)
00330         {
00331         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00332 
00333         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00334             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00335         }   
00336 
00337     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00338        could be much lazier. */
00339     if(tcb->user_task)
00340         rthal_disable_fpu();
00341 
00342 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00343 }

00347 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00348 
00349     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00350 }

00352 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00353 
00354 {
00355     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00356                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00357                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00358                                      NULL,
00359                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00360 }
00361 
00362 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00363 
00364 {
00365     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00366                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00367                                      NULL,
00368                                      NULL,
00369                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00370 }

00373 
00374 {

00376     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00377 }
00378 
00379 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00381 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask)
00382 
00383 {
00384     return 0;
00385 }
00386 
00387 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00388 
00389 {
00390     return 0;
00391 }
00392 
00393 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00394 
00395 {
00396     return 0;
00397 }

00399 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00400 
00401 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00402 
00403 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00404 
00405 {
00406 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00407     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00408        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00409     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00410 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00411 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00412     xnshadow_release_events();
00413 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00414     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00415     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00416     schedule_timeout(50);
00417     xnarch_release_ipi();
00418 }
00419 
00420 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00421 
00422 {
00423     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00424 
00425     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00426         {
00427         spl_t s;
00428         splsync(s);
00429         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00430         splexit(s);
00431         return 1;
00432         }
00433 
00434     return 0;
00435 }
00436 
00437 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00438 
00439 {
00440 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00441     xnshadow_grab_events();
00442 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00443 }
00444 
00445 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00446 
00447 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00448 
00449 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00450 
00451     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00452     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00453     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00454 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00455     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00456     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00457 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00458     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00459 }
00460 
00461 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00462 
00463 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00464 
00465 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00466                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00467                                            const char *name)
00468 {
00469     struct task_struct *task = current;
00470 
00471     tcb->user_task = task;
00472     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00473     tcb->ksp = 0;
00474     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00475 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00476     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00477     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00478 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00479     tcb->entry = NULL;
00480     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00481     tcb->self = thread;
00482     tcb->imask = 0;
00483     tcb->name = name;
00484 }
00485 
00486 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00487 
00488 {
00489     unsigned irq;
00490 
00491     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00492         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00493                              handler,
00494                              NULL,
00495                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00496 
00497     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00498        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00499        individually. */
00500 
00501     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00502                          handler,
00503                          NULL,
00504                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00505 }
00506 
00507 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00508 
00509 {
00510     unsigned irq;
00511 
00512     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00513         {
00514         switch (irq)
00515             {
00516 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00517             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00518 
00519                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00520                 continue;
00521 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00522 
00523             default:
00524 
00525                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00526             }
00527         }
00528 
00529     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00530 }
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00533 
00534 {
00535     unsigned irq;
00536 
00537     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00538         {
00539         switch (irq)
00540             {
00541 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00542             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00543 
00544                 continue;
00545 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00546 
00547             default:
00548 
00549                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00550             }
00551         }
00552 
00553     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00554 }
00555 
00556 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00557 
00558 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00559 
00560 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00561     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00562        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00563        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00564        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00565        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00566        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00567     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00568 }
00569 
00570 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00571     rthal_timer_release();
00572 }
00573 
00574 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00575 
00576 {
00577 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00578     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00579 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00580     return 0;
00581 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00582 }
00583 
00584 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00585 
00586 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00587 
00588 #include <linux/init.h>
00589 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00590 
00591 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00592 
00593 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00594 
00595 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00596 
00597 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00598 
00599 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00600 
00601 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00602 
00603 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00604 
00605 {
00606     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00607     fltinfo.exception = evinfo->event;
00608     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00609     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00610 }
00611 
00612 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00613 
00614 {
00615 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00616     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00617 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00618     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00619        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00620     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00621 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00622 }
00623 
00624 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00625 
00626 {
00627     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00628 
00629     if (!nktimerlat)
00630         return -ENODEV;
00631 
00632     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00633 
00634     return 0;
00635 }
00636 
00637 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00638 
00639 {
00640     int err;
00641 
00642 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00643     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00644        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00645     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00646 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00647 
00648     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00649 
00650     if (err)
00651         return err;
00652 
00653     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00654 
00655     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00656         return -ENOSYS;
00657 
00658     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00659                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00660                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00661                               NULL,
00662                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00663 
00664     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00665 
00666 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00667     err = xnshadow_mount();
00668 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00669 
00670     if (err)
00671         {
00672         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00673         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00674         }
00675 
00676     return err;
00677 }
00678 
00679 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00680 
00681 {
00682 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00683     xnshadow_cleanup();
00684 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00685     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00686     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00687 }
00688 
00689 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00690 
00691 #ifdef __cplusplus
00692 }
00693 #endif
00694 
00695 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00696 
00697 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00698 
00699 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
